condition.description:
Bipolar disorder is a serious mental illness. People who have it go through unusual mood changes. They go from very happy, "up," and active to very sad and hopeless, "down," and inactive, and then back again. They often have normal moods in between. The up feeling is called mania. The down feeling is depression.

The causes of bipolar disorder aren't always clear. It runs in families. Abnormal brain structure and function may also play a role.

Bipolar disorder often starts in a person's late teen or early adult years. But children and adults can have bipolar disorder too. The illness usually lasts a lifetime.

If you think you may have it, tell your health care provider. A medical checkup can rule out other illnesses that might cause your mood changes.

If not treated, bipolar disorder can lead to damaged relationships, poor job or school performance, and even suicide. However, there are effective treatments to control symptoms: medicine and talk therapy. A combination usually works best.

NIH: National Institute of Mental Health
indications: bipolar i disorder (manic and mixed episodes)
condition.name: Bipolar disorder
symptoms: Mania: Feeling "up", happy, active, or irritable
Depression: Feeling "down", sad, inactive, and hopeless

basics.benefits_moa: Abilify is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Abilify is good for treating psychosis and mania, and can help with depression. Less likely to cause side effects than any other antipsychotic, but has a risk of suicidal thoughts for people age 24 and younger.
downsides: Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.
Not available as a generic, so it's more expensive.

userStories.tip: I was on Abilify for almost 8 months with no improvement in depression, in fact I became a depressed tank! Within 7 months, I went from 130 to 180 lbs., I'm  5'2"!! Pdoc didn't seemed concerned, but my rheumatologist sure did.

The Dr. prescribed  5mg Abilify in addition to 40 mg Prozac for my daughter's Anxiety Disorders.   She was 10 years old (now 11).  She gained 30 pounds in 11 months.  Discontinuing Abilify now.  Considering Latuda??
It is really expensive if you don't have insurance, but I seem to feel a lot better and more present in my own mind.

I have taken this for one day and I cannot eat, drink, or even move without severe nausea and sweating. I'm becoming more psychotic as I can compare this 100% to Risperidone. I've had suicidal thoughts and have been becoming angry.
I just wanted to sleep all the time.

All it does is makes you sick to your stomach and not able to sleep. Then when I stop I find my food & drink are being laced with it. BEWARE THIS PHARMA COMPANY IS A BUNCH OF STALKERS! DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING FROM THEM!
My brain felt great, but my body did not - experienced weight gain and severe constipation.
Damaging effects of the drug.

Insomnia every night. If you can't sleep you can't function. Nausea, diahreehea, anxiety, low blood sugar, hypoglycaemia which causes, weakness, dizziness and fatigue. When I wasn't nauseas, I was starving. If I slept, hunger would wake me.
Can cause blood sugar to go so high you get pancreatitis
I ended up having to take only 2.5 mg per day so I wouldn't fall asleep driving. It is hard to cut up a 10 mg tablet into fourths but it seemed to help.
Always keep a steady supply so you don't run out. Withdrawals are no fun. I felt an electric shock sensation all throughout my body
ugh. tried coming off it, made me suicidal. now i'm back on
taking for bi polar and depression
Abilify caused severe constipation for me. To the point that I had to stop taking it. I tried everything that would normal help with constipation and none of it worked.

Worst medicine ever for bipolar II disorder. Vision impairment. I couldn't clearly see road signs due to the blurred vision, let alone a computer screen. Constant joint itching. Could not sit still. Embarrassed as I looked like a "tweaker".

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Abilify is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Abilify may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Abilify is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Abilify can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Abilify can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Abilify causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Abilify is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Abilify is the least likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Abilify can cause you to gain weight. Abilify is the least likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Abilify impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Phenylketonuria (PKU)
risks_warnings.description: Abilify Discmelt contains Aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take the  Discmelt. You can still take the oral swallow tablet.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Low body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: Follow dose adjustments set by your doctor to minimize skin rash.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Report rash, blurry vision, fever, persistent headache, or neck stiffness to your doctor.
Makes hormonal birth control less effective.
Takes 4 to 6 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Lamictal is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to calm nerve activity in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Lamictal is most useful for treating severe seizure disorders, and for bipolar disorder with more depression symptoms than manic symptoms. Just be careful to increase your dose slowly to avoid skin rash.
downsides: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

upsides: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.
Doesn't require routine blood tests.

Doesn't require routine blood tests.

userStories.tip: At 200mg, I developed some really nasty forehead acne and my skin was extremely oily, even with cleaning 2x/day and retin-a. I finally saw a dermatologist who mentioned he's had patients suffer from lamictal-induced acne...not just a rash.

Weirdest/best side effect from any medicine goes to Lamictal - for the first couple weeks I had really intense and vivid movie-like dreams. It gives me horrible headaches but I take it before bed so I sleep through it.
It saved my life...but titrate slowly. Too high = what I call "woo woo's"; cerebral palsy-like symptoms (full body jerks, almost seizure like but fully aware & able to communicate).
Need to monitor for liver toxicity
Blurred vision, uncontrolled muscle jerks, shaking
Double Vision is really a hassle comes and goes. Tremors, have an unexpected jerk in my hand. Have knocked things over and off the stand, but helps control my anger.

The generic versions do not work. I found out the hard way - I was switched to the generic and ended up with a very bad depression. Things turned around once the insurance co approved the brand name. It is pricey.

userStories.identifier: Woman with PTSD and Bipolar II disorder
userStories.tip: Has changed my life in evening out my mood- no hypo mania but kind of miss feeling more motivated. Have trouble initiating and have to take a lot of countering supplements to deal with fuzzy brain. Worsening soluble vision is a problem.
Doctors don't tell you it causes double vision. Also can cause fuzzy thinking at higher doses- sometimes called "Lamictal Stupid."

stick with it for a little more time b4 you count it out /don't play with doses! it took at least 6mnths (after months of figuring out and getting up to right dose with my dr) for me to realize how much less severe & freqnt episodes were!
Take it slow. Don't expect overnight changes.
supresses libido at 75 mg

I feel great on lamotrigine. Other seizure drugs depressed me.
But... not all manufacturers' pills are the same. My pharmacist must give me pills from the same generic company. Glaxo-SK's Lamictal is one of the worst for me.
Splitting up dosages in the morning and evening helps with "smoothening" out the side effects such as dizziness. Definitely take the branded XR version. Generic Lamotrigine was horrible for me.

I was on Serezone for 10 years and stopped working. I augmented with Lamictal and it made a world of difference. I have a lot more energy and my outlook has changed.  As of 2 months ago, I am no longer on Serezone, just Lamictal. It is great
userStories.identifier: Active, in great shape, feel like 40

userStories.tip: Lamictal saved my life. However some of the side effects are annoying such as neck pain,problems with co-ordination, ( have had a few very bad falls) judging distances  ( parking is a nightmare) and some  minor.skin problems. Overall the side effects are worth it to me. My moods are very stable. Very rarely depressed or hypomanic. Life is good.
take it twice a day... the effects do not last for 24 hours and taking it twice a day evens out your experience.
Extended release version seems to have fewer side effects than immediate-release.  Best to take in a.m.

userStories.identifier: Someone who has struggled with dysthymia
userStories.tip: It took a little tinkering to find the dosage that worked best for me.

Must titer up and down slowly... comes in 50mg and 100mg intervals so you can gradually adjust the dosage until you get it right. I take between 200mg and 300mg. It's the only medication that has consistently controlled my mood swings.
this is the first medication that worked for both seizures and bipolar disorder. seriously a life saver.

I have a pretty atypical case of bipolar, but the lamictal really cuts down on the irritability. When I'm in the depths of my depression or super manic, I'm actually pleasant to be around and don't take everything super personally.

Worked wonders for mood stability, best ever.  Do not miss a dose or you will go through nasty withdrawal! Have immunoglobulin levels checked before starting & monitored, as it can cause an immune deficiency.
Double vision went away when I started taking Lamictal Xr instead of the regular type. Haven't experienced any other side effects.
It saved my life.
Really I don't fell any hassle, even when I left for some time, the only thing that happened is my mood didn't go very well.
Take it around the same time every day. I have to take mine in the morning and at night. Also taking it with food helps curb nausea & any possible drowsiness.
if you forget to take it for a day or two you'll be okay but youll begin to feel it, life saver

userStories.identifier: A semi-retired writer; used to be pharma
userStories.tip: I take it every 12 hours. Insomnia was a problem for a month or so; I adapted. A problem is manufacturer difference. Some cause seizures (dose too high), so I stick with one and need to check its ID every time I pick up a bottle.

carousel_items: Takes 4 to 6 weeks to see full effects on thoughts and mood.
Can cause dizziness and drowsiness.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

basics.benefits_moa: Risperdal is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Risperdal is good for treating psychosis, mania, and irritability. Among newer antipsychotic medicines, more likely to cause side effects, especially weight gain and hormone problems.
downsides: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Moderate risk of weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

downsides_processed.orig: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.

Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, irritability, and aggressive behavior.
Lowers relapse rates in people with schizophrenia and people with irritability associated with autism.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

If you are on multiple medications be aware that the risk of serious side effects are higher. 
As soon as you experience any EPS take a dose of Benadryl & if that doesn't work go see your doctor asap or the hospital for a shot of Cogentin.
Serious weight gain

Too many side effects for me, had to stop. Caused blurry vision, weight gain, and a slew of other crap.
Take smaller doses throughout the day to avoid negative side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Risperdal is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Risperdal is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Risperdal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Risperdal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Risperdal causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Risperdal causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Risperdal is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Risperdal is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal can cause you to gain weight. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Risperdal can cause you to gain weight. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Risperdal impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Risperdal impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Tegretol is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to block certain kinds of nerve activity to reduce seizures and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Tegretol is useful for preventing seizures and relieving certain types of nerve pain, but interacts with many drugs.
downsides: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

downsides_processed.orig: Interacts with many other medicines and supplements.
Higher risk of skin reactions compared to other antiepileptic medicines, ranging from mild to life-threatening rash.
Can cause blurry vision, dizziness, and upset stomach.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests to see how the medicine is affecting your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.
First-line option for trigeminal neuralgia (nerve pain involving the face, head, and neck), and can relieve other types of nerve pain.
May be helpful in stabilizing mood for people with bipolar disorder.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic and partial seizures.

drugs.one_liner: Prevents seizures, stabilizes mood, and relieves nerve pain.

userStories.tip: How dependent I am on it. The pain is terrifying .

If the medicine is causing a rash, there are many topical steroids that will keep it under control- or vanquish it completely. I get the rash on my face- so when my doc prescribed fluocinolone, it oil changed my life.
make it part of your beauty routine etc so that you won't forget to take it. Always make sure you have enough and if on holiday, be sure to take a prescription along

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause a serious or life-threatening skin rash. The risk is higher for people who are also taking Depakote. If you are of Asian descent, you may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rashes to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause an increased risk for blood disorders. Your blood may be tested on a regular basis to see if it has low white blood cells (for fighting infections) or platelets (for blood clotting).

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Tegretol can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. You may need a genetic test to find out if you have a gene that causes increased risk. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to low sodium
risks_warnings.description: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

description_processed.orig: Tegretol may cause low sodium in the body (hyponatremia), especially in people who are older. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, headache, memory problems, difficulty concentrating, weakness, or falls.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Tegretol suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Tegretol, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyprexa is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Zyprexa is good for treating psychosis, mania, and agitation. More likely to cause weight gain and sleepiness than other antipsychotics.
downsides: More likely to cause weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Might make you more sleepy than some antipsychotics.
Mild risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

If prescribed, take it as prescribed! I take mine at bedtime, 1x day.  Has been a great med for me!
It worked for me, but I wish I had known what dose I needed.  When I received the right dose, it worked great.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Zyprexa is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Zyprexa is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Zyprexa can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Zyprexa causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Zyprexa can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Zyprexa causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. However, Zyprexa is less likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. Zyprexa is more likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Zyprexa impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

carousel_items: It usually takes 4 to 6 weeks to see the full effects, so hang in there and wait until it works to figure out the right dose for you.
Take Geodon twice a day, preferably with food.
Can cause drowsiness when you first start taking it, so avoid activities that require you to be alert until you know how it affects you.
Geodon can cause heart problems, so call your doctor right away if you faint or feel a change in your heartbeat.
Let your doctor know if you're taking a diuretic (water pill) or have a condition like chronic diarrhea that'll lower the amount of potassium or magnesium in your blood.

basics.benefits_moa: Geodon is a second generation antipsychotic. It treats schizophrenia and bipolar disorder by adjusting the levels of dopamine and serotonin in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Geodon treats bipolar disorder and schizophrenia, and causes fewer side effects than similar medicines. It’s not a good choice if you have heart problems.
downsides: Elderly people with dementia shouldn’t take Geodon.

You shouldn’t take Geodon if you have a history of heart problems (slow heart rate, recent heart attack, heart failure, or heart rhythm problems). It’s also not safe to take if you have low potassium or magnesium, or are taking medicines that increase the risk of this happening (diuretics).
You'll need to get blood tests before you start taking Geodon.
It causes slightly less weight gain than similar medicines.
Can't take Geodon capsules and injections at the same time. Capsules should be used instead of the injection as soon as possible.

downsides_processed.orig: Elderly people with dementia shouldn’t take Geodon.

You shouldn’t take Geodon if you have a history of heart problems (slow heart rate, recent heart attack, heart failure, or heart rhythm problems). It’s also not safe to take if you have low potassium or magnesium, or are taking medicines that increase the risk of this happening (diuretics).
You'll need to get blood tests before you start taking Geodon.
It causes slightly less weight gain than similar medicines.
Can't take Geodon capsules and injections at the same time. Capsules should be used instead of the injection as soon as possible.

upsides: Geodon can be used with lithium or valproate to better treat bipolar disorder.
Geodon can treat agitation in people with schizophrenia by reducing symptoms of anxiety, nervousness, and distress.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it has a lower risk of weight gain, hyperglycemia, and hyperlipidemia.
The Geodon capsule is available as a generic.
The injectable form can treat sudden agitation in schizophrenia when it's not possible to use the capsules.
It's available as a pill that you take by mouth daily for continuous treatment and as an injection used for short-term treatment of agitation.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Geodon may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Tell your doctor immediately if you have unusual thoughts or feel like your symptoms are getting worse.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Geodon can increase your risk of heart rhythm changes and has a higher risk of causing heart problems. It can also interact with other conditions and medicines that affect your heart, by lowering potassium and magnesium. You may need to have heart and blood tests before you start taking Geodon and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS)
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, stiff muscles, excess sweating, increased heart rate or blood pressure, and confusion. Get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal and involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Although the risk is lower compared to other antipsychotic medications, Geodon can cause muscle stiffness, feelings of restlessness (like you need to move around), and abnormal or uncontrollable facial or body movements, which could be a sign of tardive dyskinesia (TD), a potentially permanent condition. Let your doctor know if you experience any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls can happen because of a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as changing from sitting to standing. If symptoms don't go away, let your doctor know since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: The amount of Lithium that's too much for your body to handle is only a little higher than the amount in an effective dose. This means it can be easy to accidentally overdose. Symptoms of Lithium toxicity include diarrhea, vomiting, drowsiness, abnormal eye movements, muscle weakness, and lack of coordination. In severe cases, overdose can cause coma or seizures. If you think you've taken too much Lithium, stop taking it and seek medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Drug interactions (diuretics, ACE inhibitors, NSAIDs like ibuprofen)

carousel_items: Wellbutrin makes you energized, so take it in the morning to avoid difficulty sleeping later that night.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
There are no sexual side effects from this medication.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
The extended-release tablet shell can show up unchanged in your stool, but don't worry since the medication was still absorbed by your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Wellbutrin is an atypical antidepressant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Wellbutrin is good for treating depression and has fewer sexual side effects than other antidepressants, but you need to be okay with avoiding alcohol.
downsides: Wellbutrin can be stimulating, so it can cause anxiety or insomnia the first few days you're taking it.
Generally not as good as other antidepressants for people who have anxiety.
It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antidepressants.
Has a higher risk of causing seizures, especially if you have a seizure disorder, eating disorder, or if you drink alcohol. So, it's not a good medication if you drink a lot.
It contains the same ingredient as a medication that helps you to stop smoking, (Zyban), so these two meds can't be used together.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Wellbutrin is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Wellbutrin is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric effects for smoking cessation
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin is not approved for smoking cessation, but bupropion under the name Zyban is approved for this use. Some people taking it for smoking cessation have reported serious psychiatric effects, such as depression and, rarely, suicidal thoughts or behavior. These effects may be worse if you're withdrawing from nicotine because depression can be symptom of nicotine withdrawal. Watch for any sudden changes in mood, thinking, or behavior, and report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

description_processed.orig: Wellbutrin can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Wellbutrin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects.

basics.bottom_line: Depakote is good long-term prevention for epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and migraines, but can cause weight gain.

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Requires routine blood tests.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
May cause hair loss and weight gain.
Different versions of Depakote have different dosing. Be careful.
Report confusion, persistent abdominal pain, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising to your doctor.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Low body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: Follow dose adjustments set by your doctor to minimize skin rash.
Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Report rash, blurry vision, fever, persistent headache, or neck stiffness to your doctor.
Makes hormonal birth control less effective.
Takes 4 to 6 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

basics.benefits_moa: Lamictal is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to calm nerve activity in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Lamictal is most useful for treating severe seizure disorders, and for bipolar disorder with more depression symptoms than manic symptoms. Just be careful to increase your dose slowly to avoid skin rash.
downsides: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

upsides: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.
Doesn't require routine blood tests.

userStories.tip: At 200mg, I developed some really nasty forehead acne and my skin was extremely oily, even with cleaning 2x/day and retin-a. I finally saw a dermatologist who mentioned he's had patients suffer from lamictal-induced acne...not just a rash.

Weirdest/best side effect from any medicine goes to Lamictal - for the first couple weeks I had really intense and vivid movie-like dreams. It gives me horrible headaches but I take it before bed so I sleep through it.
It saved my life...but titrate slowly. Too high = what I call "woo woo's"; cerebral palsy-like symptoms (full body jerks, almost seizure like but fully aware & able to communicate).
Need to monitor for liver toxicity
Blurred vision, uncontrolled muscle jerks, shaking
Double Vision is really a hassle comes and goes. Tremors, have an unexpected jerk in my hand. Have knocked things over and off the stand, but helps control my anger.

The generic versions do not work. I found out the hard way - I was switched to the generic and ended up with a very bad depression. Things turned around once the insurance co approved the brand name. It is pricey.

userStories.identifier: Woman with PTSD and Bipolar II disorder
userStories.tip: Has changed my life in evening out my mood- no hypo mania but kind of miss feeling more motivated. Have trouble initiating and have to take a lot of countering supplements to deal with fuzzy brain. Worsening soluble vision is a problem.
Doctors don't tell you it causes double vision. Also can cause fuzzy thinking at higher doses- sometimes called "Lamictal Stupid."

stick with it for a little more time b4 you count it out /don't play with doses! it took at least 6mnths (after months of figuring out and getting up to right dose with my dr) for me to realize how much less severe & freqnt episodes were!
Take it slow. Don't expect overnight changes.
supresses libido at 75 mg

I feel great on lamotrigine. Other seizure drugs depressed me.
But... not all manufacturers' pills are the same. My pharmacist must give me pills from the same generic company. Glaxo-SK's Lamictal is one of the worst for me.
Splitting up dosages in the morning and evening helps with "smoothening" out the side effects such as dizziness. Definitely take the branded XR version. Generic Lamotrigine was horrible for me.

I was on Serezone for 10 years and stopped working. I augmented with Lamictal and it made a world of difference. I have a lot more energy and my outlook has changed.  As of 2 months ago, I am no longer on Serezone, just Lamictal. It is great
userStories.identifier: Active, in great shape, feel like 40

userStories.tip: Lamictal saved my life. However some of the side effects are annoying such as neck pain,problems with co-ordination, ( have had a few very bad falls) judging distances  ( parking is a nightmare) and some  minor.skin problems. Overall the side effects are worth it to me. My moods are very stable. Very rarely depressed or hypomanic. Life is good.
take it twice a day... the effects do not last for 24 hours and taking it twice a day evens out your experience.
Extended release version seems to have fewer side effects than immediate-release.  Best to take in a.m.

userStories.identifier: Someone who has struggled with dysthymia
userStories.tip: It took a little tinkering to find the dosage that worked best for me.

Must titer up and down slowly... comes in 50mg and 100mg intervals so you can gradually adjust the dosage until you get it right. I take between 200mg and 300mg. It's the only medication that has consistently controlled my mood swings.
this is the first medication that worked for both seizures and bipolar disorder. seriously a life saver.

I have a pretty atypical case of bipolar, but the lamictal really cuts down on the irritability. When I'm in the depths of my depression or super manic, I'm actually pleasant to be around and don't take everything super personally.

Worked wonders for mood stability, best ever.  Do not miss a dose or you will go through nasty withdrawal! Have immunoglobulin levels checked before starting & monitored, as it can cause an immune deficiency.
Double vision went away when I started taking Lamictal Xr instead of the regular type. Haven't experienced any other side effects.
It saved my life.
Really I don't fell any hassle, even when I left for some time, the only thing that happened is my mood didn't go very well.
Take it around the same time every day. I have to take mine in the morning and at night. Also taking it with food helps curb nausea & any possible drowsiness.
if you forget to take it for a day or two you'll be okay but youll begin to feel it, life saver

userStories.identifier: A semi-retired writer; used to be pharma
userStories.tip: I take it every 12 hours. Insomnia was a problem for a month or so; I adapted. A problem is manufacturer difference. Some cause seizures (dose too high), so I stick with one and need to check its ID every time I pick up a bottle.

risks_warnings.title: Meningitis
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.description: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. carousel_items: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Keppra is an antiepileptic medication. It prevents seizures by helping regulate neurotransmitters in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Keppra is effective for preventing seizures in people with epilepsy. Compared to other anti-seizure medications, it has few drug interactions and you don’t need to get your levels checked.
downsides: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

downsides_processed.orig: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

userStories.tip: I personally couldn't tolerate alcohol at all while on medication as it amplifies the side effect of drowsiness considerably.
caused anxiety, paranoia

My daughter has been taking Keppra since her seizures began over two years ago.  She began with 500mg and has slowly increased due to continued seizures to now 2500mg daily. No side effects with mostly success at this level for over a year.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I was on Keppra for 11 years, stopped 1 year ago. It caused depression. I stayed on it to focus on my career and got off at semi-retirement. Getting off it took one year; lowering the dose (very slowly) to below 1/2 caused awful seizures.

carousel_items_processed.orig: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatnening skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Taking Keppra can make you feel sleepy, dizzy, and affect your coordination. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how Keppra affects you.
risk_factors: Starting the first month of therapy
Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.description: Stopping Keppra suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Keppra, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric side effects
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may change your mood and behavior. Watch out for any changes, such as increased aggression or hostility, depression, anxiety, or rapid shifts in your mood (emotional lability). Let your doctor know if you experience these changes.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Also, meds are not a cure all so learning healthy coping mechanisms is important to your overall wellbeing.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Life post diagnosis is frustrating. Be patient with your MD and communicate openly. Give your medications time. Be prepared for failed attempts. Be compliant with your MD's instructions. Lastly, join a support group, such as DBSA.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
surveys.tip: Exercise, meditation (try yoga!), talking with a therapist, getting a dog - but only get a dog if you love them, are willing to care for them, and have the financial ability to do so.
